sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
If three quantities are in continued proportion, then prove that ratio of first to the third is the duplicate ratio of first to the second.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{Suppose that $n $, $o $, and $p $ are three terms in continued proportion.}$$

So, we get
\[
	\frac{n }{o } = \frac{o }{p }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "$$\text{
Now, lets start with the expression $\frac{n }{p }$}$$
\[
	\frac{n }{p } = \frac{n }{\input[s2v1]{} } \times \frac{\input[s2v2]{} }{p }
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{n }{p } = \frac{n }{o } \times \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{\input[s3v2]{} }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow n : p = \input[s4v1]{} ^2 : o ^2 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
Hence, we can write that ratio of first to the third is the duplicate ratio of first to the second.

Hence, proved.
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": ["o", "o"], "text": "$$\text{Multiplying numerator and denominator by $o$ we get \frac{n }{p } = \frac{n }{o } \times \frac{o }{p }}$$ "}, {"data": ["n", "o"], "text": "$$\text{Since, \frac{n}{o} = \frac{o}{p}, the above equation can be written as \frac{n }{p } = \frac{n }{o } \times \frac{n }{o }}$$"}, {"data": ["n"], "text": "The above equation can also be written as $n : p = n ^2 : o ^2$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
